s.text: In the past two years, investors have begun to make trades without a middleman by using electronic communications networks, or ECNs.
When a Federal judge ruled last Friday evening that Microsoft had abused its monopoly power, many reports noted that the company's stock price fell in "after-hours trading."
When a Federal judge ruled last Friday evening that Microsoft had abused its monopoly power, many reports noted that the company's stock price fell in "after-hours trading."
When a Federal judge ruled last Friday evening that Microsoft had abused its monopoly power, many reports noted that the company's stock price fell in "after-hours trading."
With computers making the matches, ECNs--such as Instinet, MarketXT and Datek Island -- can extend their hours.
